briefDescription: Contains a connection to each gpu on the machine.
detailedDescription: Contains a connection to each gpu on the machine.

warnings: A gpu_manager should not be constructed directly; it should be constructed by the graphics_environment.

overloads.description: Constructs a gpu_manager with no connections.
Sets up connections to each gpu based on the given settings.

exceptions: Throws std::runtime_error if there was an error while setting up the connections due to causes outside of the program.

items.name: gpus
items.briefDescription: Returns the individual connections to each gpu.

overloads.description: Returns the individual connections to each gpu.

overloads.declaration: auto gpus() const noexcept -> const std::vector<gpu_connection>&

items.name: new_job
items.briefDescription: Finds a thread on the gpu to perform a job.
items.detailedDescription: This method will try to find the best thread possible, prioritising for example threads that no jobs are currently running on.

overloads.description: Finds a thread on the gpu based on the given settings, and returns a gpu_job with a reference to that thread.

exceptions: Throws std::runtime_error if the machine has no threads at all to perform the given type of work.
